Question 6.Explanation: Pressure groups differ from political parties in so many ways. Question 12.Explanation: One of the disadvantages of proportional representation is the fact that it may lead to legitimization and increased power of parties who do not act in the interest of the society as a whole just like the Nazi party in Germany. Question 18.Question: A major way of maintaining confidence in the electoral process is by ensuring that
Question 18.Explanation: For an election to be free and fair voters must be properly registered; the electoral body must be independent; all qualified voters should be allowed to vote; counting of votes must be done publicly; there must be adequate security; election results must be announced on time; and avenues for resolving election matters must be available. Question 20.Question: The absence of the rule of law in government will bring about
Question 20.Explanation: Elements of the rule of law are supremacy of the constitution; absence of arbitrary powers; certainty of the law; independence of the judiciary; equality before the law; and respect for fundamental rights. Question 21.Question: One major factor that differentiates the presidential from the parliamentary system is
Question 21.Explanation: In a presidential system of government, the legislative is entirely different from the executive. The head of government and head of state is just one person who is elected directly by the electorates. However, in a parliamentary system of government, there is no separation of power between the executive and the judiciary. The head of government is chosen from the party which commands the majority in the legislative.
